project2.sdes

Class SDES

  • java.lang.Object
    • project2.sdes.SDES

  • public class SDES
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple DES.
    Author:
    James A. Donnell Jr., Danielle Lopez, Spencer Escalante

      • expPerm

        public boolean[] expPerm(boolean[] inp,
                         int[] epv)
        Expand and/or permute and/or select from the bit array, inp, producing an expanded/permuted/selected bit array. Use the expansion/permutation vector epv.
        Parameters:
        inp - A bit array represented as booleans, true=1, false=0.
        epv - An expansion and/or permutation and/or selection vector; all numbers in epv must be in the range 0..inp.length, i.e. they must be valid subscripts for inp.
        Returns:
        boolean[]

      • f

        public boolean[] f(boolean[] x,
                   boolean[] k)
        This is the 'round' function. It is its own inverse. f(x,k) = (L(x) xor F(R(x), k)) || R(x)
        Parameters:
        x - x input.
        k - k input.
        Returns:
        boolean[]

      • feistel

        public boolean[] feistel(boolean[] k,
                         boolean[] x)
        F(k,x) is a Feistel function. F(k,x) = P4 (s0 (L (k xor EP(x))) || s1 (R (k xor EP(x)))
        Parameters:
        k - k input.
        x - x input.
        Returns:
        boolean[]

      • sBox0

        public static boolean[] sBox0(boolean[] x)
        S-Box 0 as defined on page 330. Derived by boolean expression simplification utilizing a Karnaugh Map. y1 = x1'x2'x4 + x1'x2x4' + x1x3'x4 + x1x3x4' + x1x2x4 y2 = x1'x3' + x2x3'x4 + x1x2x4' + x1x2'x4
        Parameters:
        x - 4-bit array.
        Returns:
        boolean[]

      • sBox1

        public static boolean[] sBox1(boolean[] x)
        S-Box 1 as defined on page 330. Derived by boolean expression simplification utilizing a Karnaugh Map. y1 = x2'x3'x4 + x1'x2x4' + x2x3x4 + x1x2'x3' y2 = x1'x3x4' + x1'x2x4 + x1x3'x4' + x1x3x4
        Parameters:
        x - 4-bit array.
        Returns:
        boolean[]

      • getKey10

        private static java.lang.String getKey10(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Get a 10 bit key from the keyboard, such as 1010101010. Store it as an array of booleans in a field.
        Parameters:
        scanner - User input.
        Returns:
        String

        private boolean stringToBoolean(java.lang.String string)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean

      • xor

        public boolean[] xor(boolean[] x,
                     boolean[] y)
        Exclusive OR. x and y must have the same length. x xor y is the same as x != y.
        Parameters:
        x - x input.
        y - y input.
        Returns:
        boolean[]
